creator: chris.kelusak
title: Solidifying Sand
materials_required: Salt (Sea salt seemed to work best)
description: This project demonstrates how to create minimal surfaces using sand and solidify them using two methods: salt water and hairspray. It explores the process from creating a container for the tests to understanding how the surface responds to different parameters.
steps: Create your desired geometry using sand within a casting box. If using the saltwater method, mix the sand with salt in a 10:1 ratio.

Prepare your solidifying agent. For saltwater, dissolve 3 tablespoons of sea salt in 2 cups of warm water and pour into a spray bottle. For hairspray, ensure you have a bottle with high strength hold.
Spray the sand geometry with the chosen agent (saltwater or hairspray). Apply several coats, avoiding oversaturation. Use a heat gun or hot light to speed up the drying process if needed.
Carefully remove the sides of the casting box, using a razor blade to cut along the edges if necessary. Gently remove the loose sand from the underside of the solidified shell.
After removing the shell, remove any loose sand stuck to the bottom and spray with hairspray for added strength.
